answerText: Edith Wharton[10] This contemporary used fragments of American history such as headlines, song lyrics, and biographies to depict the struggles of American life in The 42nd Parallel, 1919, and Big Money, part of his USA Trilogy.
heading: Illinois Fall Touranment |2012 | 5 | 6 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: For 10 points each, name these early 20th century American novelists. [10] A farmer crashes his sled in love for Mattie Silver in this author's Ethan Frome and Newland Archer has an affair with the Polish countess Ellen Olenska in her The Age of Innocence.
